meanings.definition: A room where goods are sold at auction.
meanings.sent1: The saleroom was filled with people bidding on antique furniture.
meanings.sent2: I found a beautiful painting in the saleroom at the auction house.
meanings.sent3: The auctioneer accidentally knocked over a vase in the saleroom, causing a commotion.
meanings.sent4: The atmosphere in the saleroom was electric as the bidding war heated up.
meanings.sent5: The antique necklace sparkled under the bright lights of the saleroom.

meanings.definition: The area within a store where items are displayed for sale.
meanings.sent1: In the supermarket, the saleroom featured all the latest electronic gadgets.
meanings.sent2: Customers often browse through the saleroom before making a purchase.
meanings.sent3: The children were fascinated by the toys displayed in the saleroom.
meanings.sent4: The saleroom at the front of the store showcased the new arrivals.
meanings.sent5: The cozy ambiance of the saleroom made shopping a pleasant experience.
